name: Overview
main:
Conflict has resulted in displacement, targeted killings along communal lines, and human rights abuses. Protection, humanitarian access, and food security are priority needs, as continued violence, looting, and displacement cause further deterioration of an already dire humanitarian situation across the country. Needs continue to exceed available resources, and delivery of aid is expected to decline because funding remains low. 

INFORM measures CAR's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be extremely high, at 8.4/10. CAR's vulnerability is of particular concern.?
latest_developments_past:
05/04: Fire destroys shelter on an IDP camp in Kaga-Bandoro, leaving nearly 5,000 people in need of shelter and NFI assistance.?

04/04: Attack of alleged ex-Selekea  on Ngaoundaye and its vicinity, Ouham Pende, displaced hundreds of people, including into Chad and Cameroon. Over 1,100 people, of whom 80% are children and women in need of health and protection assistance, have been reported in Chad.??

04/04: 26 confirmed measles cases, out of over 40 suspected cases, have been reported in Lobaye, affecting mostly the Pygmy population.??

03/04: Over 3,150 people affected by heavy winds since mid-March in Lobaye and Ombella-M’poko prefectures. They are in need of NFIs and shelter assistance.?
